org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.amp

Class AmpFundingColumn

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.schema.NiReportedEntity<K>
      • org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.schema.NiReportColumn<K>
        • org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.schema.SqlSourcedColumn<K>
          • org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.amp.PsqlSourcedColumn<CategAmountCell>
            • org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.amp.AmpFundingColumn
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MtefColumn

    public class AmpFundingColumn
extends PsqlSourcedColumn<CategAmountCell>
    the NiReportColumn which fetches funding cells. This class is the common ancestors for all the coordinates-based funding cells in the AMP schema (that is, all of them except Proposed Project Cost): [Donor / Component / Pledges] Funding, the MTEF columns.
    This class implements a 2-level caching akin to AmpDifferentialColumn, except that the first level is degenerating: it is a boolean whose key always equals true.
    Earlier implementations of this class were a true 2-level cache, the key of the first level being the 3-tuple (calendar, currency, locale); this was abandoned because it might lead to big amounts of memory being consumed on the Cartesian product of the key: each cell might be duplicated upto (nr_currencies x nr_calendars x nr_locales) times.
    Thus, the AMP schema uses a different schema for caching funding cells: what is actually cached in the level2-caches in DifferentialCache is cell prototypes. A cell prototype is an instance of CategAmountCellProto: a class which closely mirrors CategAmountCell, but has its fields dependent on locale / calendar / currency unpopulated. Through materialization, a CategAmountCellProto builds (cheaply) a CategAmountCell instance which is then output to the client code.
    Thus, the fetching of AMP's funding columns is a multiprocess step like this:
    1. the necessary cell prototypes are fetched differentially and stored in the DifferentialCache instance which is a member of FundingFetcherContext. Please see AmpReportsScratchpad.differentiallyImportCells(org.dgfoundation.amp.algo.timing.InclusiveTimer, String, DifferentialCache, java.util.function.Function)
    2. all the relevant prototypes (which is a superset of the just-fetched cells) are materialized. This cheap operation can be performed because at report runtime, the 3 parameters driving materialization are all known
    Please note that the materialized cells are ephemeral: running two consecutive reports with identical (calendar, currency, locale) settings will lead to materialization being rerun. This is a low-hanging fruit for dashboards-like scenarios where the same funding column fetching settings are being used repeatedly in a matter of seconds.
    An another point of this class is that, at initialization, it scans the backing view for missing columns and will not attempt to read those from the view. Some minor functionality is configured hardcodedly via the fetcher looking up the column it is fetching. The following constants are a non-exhaustive list of names of columns which are fetched by this column: ENTITY_COMPONENT_FUNDING, ENTITY_DONOR_FUNDING, ENTITY_PLEDGE_FUNDING. Some columns (most notably, the MTEF family of columns) do not have dedicated entries in the column code

      • AmpFundingColumn

        protected AmpFundingColumn(java.lang.String columnName,
                           LocalizableLabel label,
                           java.lang.String viewName,
                           Behaviour<?> behaviour,
                           SubDimensions subDimensions)
        constructs an instance which will fetch a given AMP entity from a given PostgreSQL view with a given Behaviour. As part of initialisation, the view is scanned for columns which are supported by AMP Funding but are missing from the view. Any such viewcolumns (and their associated NiDimensionUsage's) will be ignored by this instance upon fetching
        Parameters:
        columnName - the name of the AMP entity (column) to fetch
        viewName - the name of the PostgreSQL view to fetch data from
        behaviour - the behaviour of the column
